Class TelegramBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • pro.zackpollard.telegrambot.api.TelegramBot

extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Zack Pollard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String API_URL
      The API URL endpoint that is constant for all bots

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static TelegramBot login(java.lang.String authToken)
        Use this method to get a new TelegramBot instance with the selected auth token
        Parameters:
        authToken - The bots auth token
        Returns:
        A new TelegramBot instance or null if something failed

      • getChat

        public Chat getChat(long chatID)
        A method used to get a Chat object via the chats ID
        Parameters:
        chatID - The Chat ID of the chat you want a Chat object of
        Returns:
        A Chat object or null if the chat does not exist or you don't have permission to get this chat

        A method used to get a Chat object via the chats ID
        Parameters:
        chatID - The Chat ID of the chat you want a Chat object of
        Returns:
        A Chat object or null if the chat does not exist or you don't have permission to get this chat

      • getBotAPIUrl

        public java.lang.String getBotAPIUrl()
        This provides the URL used to make all the API calls to the bot API
        Returns:
        The URL used to make all the API calls to the bot API

      • sendMessage

        public Message sendMessage(Chat chat,
                           SendableMessage message)
        This will send the provided SendableMessage object to the Chat that the Chat object represents
        Parameters:
        chat - The chat you want to send the message to
        message - The message you want to send to the chat
        Returns:
        A Message object that represents the message you sent, or null if sending failed

      • editMessageText

        public Message editMessageText(Message oldMessage,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               ParseMode parseMode,
                               boolean disableWebPagePreview,
                               InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)
        This allows you to edit the text of a message you have already sent previously
        Parameters:
        oldMessage - The Message object that represents the message you want to edit
        text - The new text you want to display
        parseMode - The ParseMode that should be used with this new text
        disableWebPagePreview - Whether any URLs should be displayed with a preview of their content
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        A new Message object representing the edited message

      • editMessageText

        public Message editMessageText(java.lang.String chatId,
                               java.lang.Long messageId,
                               java.lang.String text,
                               ParseMode parseMode,
                               boolean disableWebPagePreview,
                               InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)
        This allows you to edit the text of a message you have already sent previously
        Parameters:
        chatId - The chat ID of the chat containing the message you want to edit
        messageId - The message ID of the message you want to edit
        text - The new text you want to display
        parseMode - The ParseMode that should be used with this new text
        disableWebPagePreview - Whether any URLs should be displayed with a preview of their content
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        A new Message object representing the edited message

      • editInlineMessageText

        public boolean editInlineMessageText(java.lang.String inlineMessageId,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     ParseMode parseMode,
                                     boolean disableWebPagePreview,
                                     InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)
        This allows you to edit the text of an inline message you have sent previously. (The inline message must have an InlineReplyMarkup object attached in order to be editable)
        Parameters:
        inlineMessageId - The ID of the inline message you want to edit
        text - The new text you want to display
        parseMode - The ParseMode that should be used with this new text
        disableWebPagePreview - Whether any URLs should be displayed with a preview of their content
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        True if the edit succeeded, otherwise false

                                  java.lang.String caption,
                                  InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)

        Parameters:
        oldMessage - The Message object that represents the message you want to edit
        caption - The new caption you want to display
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        A new Message object representing the edited message

        messageId - The message ID of the message you want to edit

      • editInlineCaption

        public boolean editInlineCaption(java.lang.String inlineMessageId,
                                 java.lang.String caption,
                                 InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)
        This allows you to edit the caption of any captionable inline message you have sent previously (The inline message must have an InlineReplyMarkup object attached in order to be editable)
        Parameters:
        inlineMessageId - The ID of the inline message you want to edit
        caption - The new caption you want to display
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        True if the edit succeeded, otherwise False

        Parameters:
        oldMessage - The Message object that represents the message you want to edit
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        A new Message object representing the edited message

        messageId - The message ID of the message you want to edit
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message

      • editInlineMessageReplyMarkup

        public boolean editInlineMessageReplyMarkup(java.lang.String inlineMessageId,
                                            InlineReplyMarkup inlineReplyMarkup)
        This allows you to edit the InlineReplyMarkup of any inline message that you have sent previously. (The inline message must have an InlineReplyMarkup object attached in order to be editable)
        Parameters:
        inlineMessageId - The ID of the inline message you want to edit
        inlineReplyMarkup - Any InlineReplyMarkup object you want to edit into the message
        Returns:
        True if the edit succeeded, otherwise False

      • answerInlineQuery

        public boolean answerInlineQuery(java.lang.String inlineQueryId,
                                 InlineQueryResponse inlineQueryResponse)
        This allows you to respond to an inline query with an InlineQueryResponse object
        Parameters:
        inlineQueryId - The ID of the inline query you are responding to
        inlineQueryResponse - The InlineQueryResponse object that you want to send to the user
        Returns:
        True if the response was sent successfully, otherwise False

      • answerCallbackQuery

        public boolean answerCallbackQuery(java.lang.String callbackQueryId,
                                   java.lang.String text,
                                   boolean showAlert)
        This allows you to respond to a callback query with some text as a response. This will either show up as an alert or as a toast on the telegram client
        Parameters:
        callbackQueryId - The ID of the callback query you are responding to
        text - The text you would like to respond with
        showAlert - True will show the text as an alert, false will show it as a toast notification
        Returns:
        True if the response was sent successfully, otherwise False

      • kickChatMember

        public boolean kickChatMember(java.lang.String chatId,
                              int userId)
        Use this method to kick a user from a group or a supergroup. In the case of supergroups, the user will not be able to return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the group for this to work
        Parameters:
        chatId - The ID of the chat that you want to kick the user from
        userId - The ID of the user that you want to kick from the chat
        Returns:
        True if the user was kicked successfully, otherwise False

      • unbanChatMember

        public boolean unbanChatMember(java.lang.String chatId,
                               int userId)
        Use this method to unban a previously kicked user in a supergroup. The user will not return to the group automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator in the group for this to work
        Parameters:
        chatId - The ID of the chat that you want to unban the user from
        userId - The ID of the user that you want to unban from the chat
        Returns:
        True if the user was unbanned, otherwise False

      • startUpdates

        public boolean startUpdates(boolean getPreviousUpdates)
        Use this method to start the update thread which will begin retrieving messages from the API and firing the relevant events for you to process the data
        Parameters:
        getPreviousUpdates - Whether you want to retrieve any updates that haven't been processed before, but were created prior to calling the startUpdates method
        Returns:
        True if the updater was started, otherwise False

      • stopUpdates

        public void stopUpdates()
        Calling this method will stop the updater from running and therefore no more events will be fired

      • getEventsManager

        public ListenerRegistry getEventsManager()
        This provides access to the events manager which can be used to register and unregister Listeners
        Returns:
        The current events manager as a ListenerRegistry object
